sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá G̱athéeni yóo duwasáagu yé áwé áa yéi ḵuteex̱ín yu deikée Yantʼiká.
sentences.sentence_english: This place called G̱athéeni is where people lived, out there along the ocean.

áa yéi ḵuteex̱ín yu deikée Yantʼiká.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áyá chʼáagu ḵáawu áwé yéi yateeyi yé.

lines.line_english: Perhaps he made a raft to cross it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Haanaanax̱.á áwé yéi duwasáakw yá south niyaanax̱ á Nagootkʼí á.
sentences.sentence_english: On the near side of it this south side of it is what is called Nagootkʼí.

lines.line_english: On the near side of it

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Gwáa!
sentences.sentence_english: Hey!

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Lingít du géide yaa nagút.
sentences.sentence_english: A Tlingit was coming toward Ḵaakexʼwtí.

lines.line_english: A Tlingit was coming toward Ḵaakexʼwtí.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A daasheeyí ḵudzitee yá du géide yaa nagúdi tléil ḵu.aa wé x̱wsakú.
sentences.sentence_english: There is a song for this, the one who was coming toward him, but I don’t know it.

lines.line_english: There is a song for this,
the one who was coming toward him,

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A yáanaa yéi koowáatʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: His pack was very tall.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlax̱ du x̱áng̱aa yaa kagooséi áwé du toowúch kindachóon yawdzi.aa.
sentences.sentence_english: When he was closer to him he thought he lifted his head.

lines.line_tlingit: Tlax̱ du x̱áng̱aa yaa kagooséi áwé du toowúch kindachóon yawdzi.aa.
lines.line_english: When he was closer to him he thought he lifted his head.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Gwáa, té gwáawé gé.
sentences.sentence_english: Hey! It was a rock.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ách áwé yéi wduwasáa chʼu yáa yagiyeedé Nagootkʼí.
sentences.sentence_english: That’s why it’s called even till today “The Little Walker.”

lines.line_tlingit: Ách áwé yéi wduwasáa chʼu yáa yagiyeedé
lines.line_english: That’s why it’s called even till today

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle ách wududlisáa.
sentences.sentence_english: It was given that name then.

lines.line_english: It was given that name then.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ḵux̱ wudigút tle tsu.
sentences.sentence_english: He went back again.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aag̱áa gwál wáa sákwshé yéi kaawayáatʼ neilxʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: Then perhaps he stayed long at home.

lines.line_tlingit: Aag̱áa gwál wáa sákwshé yéi kaawayáatʼ neilxʼ.
lines.line_english: Then perhaps he stayed long at home.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Gwál tsu dís shuwdag̱aaxeex.
sentences.sentence_english: Perhaps a month went by.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yáaxʼ áwé woosh kaadé yéi awsinei gíwé wé a x̱oot uwagudi wé tináa, daa sákwshé tsú aan, á áwé du yátxʼich gag̱ayaayít áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: Maybe here he collected those coppers he came upon, whatever else with them all his children could pack.

lines.line_tlingit: Yáaxʼ áwé woosh kaadé yéi awsinei gíwé wé a x̱oot uwagudi
lines.line_english: Maybe here he collected those coppers

lines.line_tlingit: á áwé du yátxʼich gag̱ayaayít áwé.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yan has née áwé g̱unéi has uwa.át éeḵnáx̱. Yaa s na.át.
sentences.sentence_english: When they were ready they began walking along the beach. They walked.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A shákdé wé Tʼaayxʼaa gíwé áa daaḵ has uwa.át.
sentences.sentence_english: Maybe they came up there toward the head of Dixon Harbor.

lines.line_tlingit: A shákdé wé Tʼaayxʼaa gíwé áa daaḵ has uwa.át.
lines.line_english: Maybe they came up there toward the head of Dixon Harbor.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Gootʼá ḵwa sá kwshíwé?
sentences.sentence_english: But where were they?

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa yeisú aadáx̱ daak yakw.uwaḵúx̱. We x̱ʼaan chʼa yeisú x̱ʼaanx̱ sitee wé gán.
sentences.sentence_english: People had just left. The wood was still embers.

lines.line_tlingit: We x̱ʼaan chʼa yeisú x̱ʼaanx̱ sitee wé gán.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé áa daak has uwa.át wé aan tsu aan.
sentences.sentence_english: That was the settiement they came on also a settlement.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé áa daak has uwa.át wé aan
lines.line_english: That was the settiement they came on

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chookaneidí áwé naakéede ḵuwa.óo.
sentences.sentence_english: The Chookaneidí lived uppermost in the bay.

lines.line_english: The Chookaneidí lived uppermost in the bay.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A niyaadé ḵuwa.óo Kaagwaantaan.
sentences.sentence_english: Next to them lived the Kaagwaantaan.

lines.line_english: Next to them lived the Kaagwaantaan.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá Kaagwaantaan ḵu.aa áwé sdu íx̱tʼi ḵudzitee.
sentences.sentence_english: The Kaagwaantaan had a shaman.

lines.line_tlingit: Yá Kaagwaantaan ḵu.aa áwé sdu íx̱tʼi ḵudzitee.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé át at shuwootéeych at sheeyí.
sentences.sentence_english: He was the one who would predict when he sang.

lines.line_tlingit: Á áwé át at shuwootéeych at sheeyí.
lines.line_english: He was the one who would predict when he sang.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlʼanaxéedáḵwt áwé ooltaanch.
sentences.sentence_english: He would compare it to Tlʼanaxéedaḵw.

lines.line_english: He would compare it to Tlʼanaxéedaḵw.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yéi áwé ash waag̱í yatee.
sentences.sentence_english: That is how he looked to him.

lines.line_english: That is how he looked to him.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá Tlʼanaxéedáḵw ḵu.aa áyá Auke Bay-dáx̱ áyá ḵuwdzitee.
sentences.sentence_english: Tlʼanaxéedaḵw originated from Auke Bay.

lines.line_tlingit: Yá Tlʼanaxéedáḵw ḵu.aa áyá Auke Bay-dáx̱ áyá ḵuwdzitee.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A yakg̱wahéiyagu yáx̱ áwé ash tuwáa yatee; ha aadóoch sá wsiteen hú áwé aan ḵáawux̱ sateex̱ín, wé Tlʼanaxéedáḵw.
sentences.sentence_english: It looked to him like her ghost; well, whoever saw Tlʼanaxéedaḵw would become rich.

lines.line_tlingit: A yakg̱wahéiyagu yáx̱ áwé ash tuwáa yatee; ha aadóoch sá wsiteen
lines.line_english: It looked to him like her ghost; well, whoever saw

lines.line_tlingit: hú áwé aan ḵáawux̱ sateex̱ín, wé Tlʼanaxéedáḵw.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yéi áyá at shée nuch yá yéik.
sentences.sentence_english: This is how those shaman spirits would sing.

lines.line_tlingit: Yéi áyá at shée nuch yá yéik.
lines.line_english: This is how those shaman spirits would sing.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlʼanaxéedáḵw yaa nagúdi.
sentences.sentence_english: The coming of Tlʼanaxéedaḵw.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Yee gu.aa yáx̱ xʼwán,” yóo adaayaḵá du xwáaxʼu.
sentences.sentence_english: He told his men, “Be brave.”

lines.line_tlingit: “Yee gu.aa yáx̱ xʼwán,” yóo adaayaḵá du xwáaxʼu.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa yákʼwde áwé áa daak aawa.át.
sentences.sentence_english: All of a sudden people came out there.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼa yákʼwde áwé áa daak aawa.át.
lines.line_english: All of a sudden people came out there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Lingit diyáawu.
sentences.sentence_english: People were across the river.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aadé yoo x̱ʼadudli.átk; chush x̱ʼéináx̱ yoo s x̱ʼali.átk.
sentences.sentence_english: People were talking there; they were speaking their language.

lines.line_tlingit: Aadé yoo x̱ʼadudli.átk; chush x̱ʼéináx̱ yoo s x̱ʼali.átk.
lines.line_english: People were talking there; they were speaking their language.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áyá Chookaneidí “háatkées” gíwé áa yux̱ wujixeex.
sentences.sentence_english: Maybe it was a “hard case” Chookaneidí who ran out there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Ixinaawú á, ixinaawú, yee káa at xáshgu ḵu.oo kóoshdaa ḵáaxʼw sáani.” Yóo áwé ayawsiḵaa.
sentences.sentence_english: “They’re down the bay! They’re down the bay! The people who were cutting tongues to get you, you little land otter people,” is what he said.

lines.line_tlingit: ixinaawú, yee káa at xáshgu ḵu.oo
lines.line_english: They’re down the bay! The people who were cutting tongues to get you,

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Kóoshdaa ḵáax̱ áwé aksanéek.
sentences.sentence_english: He claimed they were land otter people.

lines.line_english: He claimed they were land otter people.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yéi ayawsiḵaa du yátxʼi “ixinaadé haa kdunáa.” Ách áwé yéi at g̱adudlikóo “chush keekaadáx̱ G̱unanaa aa kawduḵaayín.” Yá Chookaneidí áwé yéi wdzigeet.
sentences.sentence_english: So Ḵaakexʼwtí told his children, “They’re telling us to go down the bay.” That’s why there's a proverb about “sending Athabaskans down the opposite bay.” It was a Chookaneidí who did that.

lines.line_english: “They’re telling us to go down the bay.”
about “sending Athabaskans down the opposite bay.”
It was a Chookaneidí who did that.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: De áwu wé íx̱tʼ, wé Kaagwaantaan íx̱tʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: The shaman was already there, the Kaagwaantaan shaman.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aag̱áa áwé tsu yéi ḵuyaawaḵaa, “Lingít áhé diyáanax̱.áwu.” Tle du een kawduwaneek wé íx̱tʼ, “Á áwé, á áwé.” Hasdu kaanáx̱ áwé kaa loowagooḵ. “Gwaʼ! tináa gwáawé gé sdu jee.” Aag̱áa áyá akawlineek aadé yoo kawdiyayi yé.
sentences.sentence_english: That’s when they to1d him “There are some people across the bay.” The shaman immediately to1d them “They are the ones, they are the ones.” Then the people ran out to them. “Hey! They have coppers!” That is when he told what happened to him.

lines.line_english: “There are some people across the bay.”

lines.line_tlingit: Tle du een kawduwaneek wé íx̱tʼ,

lines.line_english: Then the people ran out to them.
he told what happened to him.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aag̱áa gíyás tle yaakwnáx̱ akaawa.aaḵw.
sentences.sentence_english: Maybe that’s when he tried by boat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áa yoo ḵuyaawagóo hé Iḵhéeni.
sentences.sentence_english: Boats went to the Copper River.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aag̱áa áyá yawduwadláḵwxʼ yá eeḵ. Yáade ḵu.aa wé aan káaxʼuch.
sentences.sentence_english: That is where copper was acquired. But only for the rich peop1e.

lines.line_english: That is where copper was acquired.
But only for the rich peop1e.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aan ḵáaxʼu jiyís yéi daa wduwanei.
sentences.sentence_english: It was brought here for the rich people.
